name: Le Meridien Vienna

reviews.text: The Le Meridien is one of the newer hotels, compared to the historic hotels in Wien. It was completely redone and is fresh feeling from the lobby to the rooms, bar, and restaurant. The staff were all very friendly with check-in, minor complaints, directions, etc.
reviews.title: very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room I had was one of the smallest in the hotel, based on the fire escape plan, but was bigger than most European rooms. The bed was not a sweet sleeper, more like a version from Ikea, comfortable, but not worthy of a Starwood hotel. I was very happy to have a coffee maker given that room service coffee was around 12 Euro. As other reviewers have noted, the two chairs in the room are completely impossible to sit in, maybe my 3 year-old would fit, but an average adult cannot. The TV was extremely limited with only CNN and BBC as your English choices. Then the bathroom, whoever designed in ripped off the hotel. The sink takes up about 80% of the space meaning that your razor, toothbrush etc have to be placed on one of the four corners, with limited space so that you either have to put stuff on the little glass bench under the sink or on the desk. The shower is great, but you do end up having to throw a towel on the floor or you will slip on the water that has been splashed all over.
reviews.title: Great rooms but....................

likes.disliked: — John Harris gym, improperly addressed as MR...., and noisy maids

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The gym is very good, the staff was friendly and helfpul, the pool was adequate and the hotub quite large.
reviews.title: Designer heaven, but not quite so for guests
Fantastic Hotel - Highly Recommended - A MUST!
reviews.text: The bar had a very unfriendly atmosphere and the staff was beyond bored and rude. One evening a businessman stumbled past my table and slipped, knocking my drink off in the process. When I was asked if I wanted another, of course I said yes, except they charged me for the replacement drink and refused to deduct it saying that it wasn't the bars fault he spilled my drink. So it goes.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant is excellent and worth every penny. Be careful of the water list, I've never seen water from Tennessee that cost 88 Euro for a 0.5L bottle. I chose the tap water.
reviews.title: Vienna in the Spring

reviews.text: One of THE best hotels I have ever stayed in. Staff, room, shower, location, etc.
reviews.title: Great Extras

reviews.text: What I want to rave about (already done by many previous posts, but can't be raved about enough) is the FREE internet and FREE beverage bar! I can't say enough about how nice it is to come back after a long day and have a bottle of soda, beer, water, juice waiting for me cold in the fridge. And not paying $5 for it. Don't drink diet and they added extra non diet Coke instead.
reviews.title: Perfect Engagement Hotel

reviews.text: And why can't all the other high end hotels give free internet in their rooms!
reviews.title: We loved this hotel!

reviews.text: The plan was to take my girlfriend to Vienna to propose and as I am sure every man will agree, you want everything to be perfect. So, it was with much excitment I booked Le Meridien. I chose to upgrade the room before we arrived and I was certainly not disappointed.
reviews.title: extra points for style!

reviews.text: To start with Vienna is magnificent and Le Meridien blends in well. The staff were very efficient upon our arrival and our room was immediately available. And what a room it was. It was huge and luxurious. The free bar went down very well.
reviews.title: Coolest Hotel Ever!
Great modern hotel... with beautiful bathrooms
reviews.text: This is a great hotel in a perfect location. The staff is professional and well educated. My room was large and had a fantastic bathroom. The gym and water facilities were great too. I would highly recommend this hotel.

reviews.title: Perfect Location
reviews.text: The Le Meridian Hotel in Vienna is located on the Opernring and has a perfect location. It is located 1-2 blocks from the Opera, Kartnerstrasse, Hofburg and the Albertina. The U-bahn and tram stop is the Karlsplatz. The hotel is walking distance to several attractions including the St. Stephens Church, Lippizaner Museum, St. Peterskirche, Nachmarkt, Judisches Museum, and the Museum Quarter There is a corner bakery called Aida which has every imaginable dessert and offers half price discounts after 7 P.M. The hotel is very decorative and modern. At check-in the assistant spoke English and was very helpful. The mini-bar is included and is stocked once a day. For 2 people, the mini bar included 4 bottles of water (still & mineral), 1 beer, 2 cokes, and 2 bottles of juice. There is free internet access in the hotel lobby. The plasma screen TV offered only news channels in English. The room was very large and the beds and pillows were comfortable. The bathroom has glass translucent doors and walls. The bathroom floor is continuous with the shower floor. A tip for not flooding the bathroom is to stand blocking the doorway so that the water doesn't flood the bathroom. If you plan on taking a cab to the airport do not allow the doorman to call for a larger cab. A standard cab costs about 30 Euros and a larger cab to the airport costs 65 Euros. Both size cabs will seat 4 people. I really enjoyed our stay at the Le Meridien in Vienna. I would stay there again if I could afford it. Our room rate was 195 Euros for 2 people.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here the middle of October for 3 nights. (We used hotel points so our stay was free.) Super location, across from the world famous Opera House. Easy to get to if arriving from the south train station (Sudbahnhof). Take the D tram stops right at the Opera house, cross the street and walk about one block. Buy a 12 euro Vienna Card-72 hour transit pass with discounts to city museums.
reviews.title: Great location-Modern Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was very modern, as other reviewers stated and the only problem was the shower. It did not have a door, so water continually spilled onto the bathroom floor. The staff is aware of this issue and they are slowly putting in shower doors in these rooms. We stayed on the 4th floor, street side and it was very quiet. Bed comfortable, good linens, nice bath amenities.
reviews.title: Near Perfect With One Major Exception

likes.disliked: — NOISE IN ROOM FROM BAR DJ UNTIL 1 AM NIGHTLY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really liked the free internet in the lobby. It came in handy for quick emails and news from home.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in good location

reviews.text: This was a contemprary and excellent hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were large and had comfortable beds. THey usually allow only three people in the room, however we were able to have our two children in the same room (6 and 9 years). They were kind enough to agree and also let us check in early (10am).
reviews.title: excellent hotel

likes.liked: — large rooms, clean, internet access included in room rate.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Teh location is central on the ringstrasse and is convenient to all sights.
reviews.title: Loved Le Meridien

reviews.text: Will definitely go there again.
reviews.title: Great hotel in Vienna

likes.liked: — location, ammenities, quality of the room

reviews.title: Le Meridien
reviews.text: We booked through QuikBooks on the internet. Stayed 3 nights. The hotel is very quiet, located on the Ring halfway between the Opera House and Hofburg Palace. The location could not be beat - we walked the old city from the hotel (Most everything was within 15-20 minutes walk. ). Five minute walk to the Opera subway station. Rooms were very clean. We did not eat in the hotel, cannot comment on the food. However, the mini bar in the room is complimentary (beer, soda, juice). The room was large with small sofa, chair, desk with internet connection, and king bed. The bathroom was quite large - walk-in shower, and tub. The Concierge at the Hotel was very helpful in getting directions, concert reservations, airport transportation, etc. All the hotels near or inside the Ring are expensive. We paid $246/night through Quikbooks which was less than other providers or the hotel.
We can highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Expensive, very good but not perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here 3 nights at the end of August to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary. Looked through Tripadvisor for suggestions and we were not disappointed. We arrived to a bottle of cold champagne in our room and nice note from the staff. Very comfortable, and ideally located. We walked everywhere. We ate at Shambala the first night since we were too tired to venture out. The food was very good, and reasonable. We did go to the bar one night but did not return since it was really too expensive for casual drinking. Its much cheaper to just walk across the street and find a cafe or bar in the inner city. The concierge made two dinner recommendations for us, one that we loved, the other not. All in all, a memorable stay.
reviews.title: Location the best, and hotel up to our expectations

reviews.text: I booked a stay at the Le Meridien following a recommendation from a friend and the good reviews on Trip Advisor. I have not been disappointed! The hotel was in a fantastic location, literally a stone's throw away from the Staatsoper and the Hofburg Palace complex.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location, Excellent Service and Cool Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The "Ambassador" service (aka the Conceirge) was most helpful and they pointed out places to visit. They also had this fantastic mini map that the hotel prints themselves - all hotels should take a note and do this. It's pretty handy, fits nicely in a pocket and was most informative (although it does leave out other hotels like the famous Saccher Hotel where you can get a Sacchertorte). The reverse has a list of attractions, but check first on the opening times - found a few to be out of date.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

likes.liked: — Modern Hotel, attention to detail, excellent staff, fantastic location

reviews.title: Great hotel but very soft mattress makes for bad backs
reviews.text: Lastly, the rooms are ultra cool - really loved the well appointed bathrooms, and the massive flat screen TV that they had mounted on the wall. Rooms were spacious and I liked the "free" mini bar! I would stay there again on another trip to Vienna.

We stayed in this hotel from the 1st to the 7th August for our Wedding Anniversary. I can honestly say this was the best hotel we have ever stayed in. Attention to details is fabulous. We got a taxi from the airport to the hotel cost of taxi was €35. We arrived at 12 O'Clock 2 hours before check in time, but it was no problem and we were checked in immediately and actually given a free upgrade to a deluxe room from Superior that we booked.
reviews.title: Never again

reviews.text: Rooms are large and quite modern, with large modern bathroom. Mine included both bath and large separate shower.
reviews.title: Modern rooms, good location

reviews.text: The building is a little odd and obviously renovated from a former use, but the rooms are well put together.
reviews.title: comfortable rooms but few minor problems...

reviews.text: I like the large screen TV on the wall, the desk with easily accessible power and Ethernet, the bed with separate reading lamps and accessible power point.
reviews.title: Awesome stay -- will definitely choose this hotel on return trip to Vienna

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The internet arrangements were very good. You could have free wireless in your room and throughout the hotel for as many devices as you wish, and ethernet in your room which was either free (256k speed limit) or €10 per day for broadband (1.5Mbps).
reviews.title: Perfect Location in Vienna

reviews.text: I think this is the best and fairest arrangement I have encountered in a hotel for Internet - well done to Le Meridien and it's supplier Internode.
reviews.title: Decent hotel for a short break

reviews.text: Nice, modern European. but be sure you don't get a western facing room or get ready to be hot. Plus, many of the standard rooms are tiny.
reviews.title: good location

reviews.text: I stayed here in Nov 2007 and can not forget it. It was like a modern art museum in the middle of Vienna, perfectly located, you can easily access anywhere by walk. The rooms are perfect, breakfast is great, you really enjoy spending time in the hotel. Definetely recommend.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel in Vienna

reviews.text: I stayed at Le Meridien for about five days in connection with a business convention held there in early September. The hotel is very close to the Opera House, and about a 15-20 minute walk from the CAT train station - the CAT will take you directly from the airport into downtown Vienna in about 16 minutes for 10 Euros. The hotel is a modernized older building, but it has been dressed up to be a very modern chic boutique hotel. There is an outdoor cafe in the back of the hotel, which was good, although service was inconsistent -- sometimes slow, and bill delayed - and the hotel's main restaurant, Shambala, was also good (but not a destination restaurant). Because the hotel was remodeled from an old building with floors on slightly different levels, you have to go up and down stairs on each floor after getting off the elevator. The room was very modern in appearance, and attractive. There was no clock, and, of course, no clock alarm, in the room. The bathroom was quite large, with a separate tub and shower area, but the shower had no door on it. My first shower completely covered the entire bathroom floor with water. After cleaning up the floor, I went down to the lobby and asked the staff if there was some trick to avoid flooding the bathroom. They told me that the shower was a "designer defect" and that they were putting doors on all the showers, but only some rooms had received their doors. I developed a strategy of putting a towel on the floor in front of the shower, and then using only the lower shower heads, aimed into the far corner of the shower, to avoid future flooding, which to a large extent prevented the floor from flooding. Others at the convention complained about shower flooding their bathrooms. The techno music and weird sound effects (jungle; water rushing) in the elevators and in common areas was a bit disconcerting and annoying. Staff was very friendly. If you need a boarding pass, they will print that out for you at front desk. Price of room was about 200 Euros per night, which was not bad, given quality of hotel and great location. Despite weirdness, I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but a bit odd

reviews.text: Friendly staff. Modern and well equipped room. Breakfast very nice but very expensive. Wifi free but slow and needed continuous log in. unusually I found it hard to sleep, perhaps because the bed was very soft and perhaps because the air conditioning was noisy.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel but I couldn't sleep

reviews.text: Very friendly staff, great air conditioned place which can be rare in Europe. Stayed twice for 2 nights on my recent trip and would stay there again. Awesome location, served breakfast to room before listed time due to early flight out. Gym was awesome, so was pool and all other common areas. Great job everyone.
reviews.title: Great choice

reviews.text: After some initial mix-ups regarding our room, we received one with fabulous views of the city. The hotel is in close proximity to all the museums and attractions in Vienna and many of its dining options. The amenities include a free minibar (14 bottles of water, Coke, juices, and beer restocked daily), highspeed Internet access, and cable TV on your large, plasma television. The bathroom includes both a three-nozzle shower and an old-fashioned clawfoot bathrub, again with a view of the city. You can pipe your television show into your shower, which is ideal if you choose MTV music videos. The front desk and hotel cleaning staff are extremely helpful, with excellent English skills.
reviews.title: Loved the Meridien

reviews.text: We have visited Vienna in a few ocassions and this hotel was by far the most fantastic an relaxing of them all. The room was very big and loved the confortable bed. The bathroom was very modern and the power shower heaven!!! Great views from the balcony and we even loved staying in watching the plasma tv... Very good breakfast in the mornings with great food to prepare you for a city walk... We enjoyed the best Gin and Tonic at the hotel bar, bit expensive, but the best in town! We enjoyed it so much that we are going back this august... By far the best hotel in Europe!!!!
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.text: Had a 3 night stay in this hotel last month and it was absolutely fabulous. perfect location, very central to the main attraction of Vienna and certainly walking distance.
reviews.title: Fantastic!! Loved it!

reviews.text: Rooms are fab! very modern and a free Mini bar! Massive 42" plasma on the wall facing the bed.
reviews.title: Fantastic room, best hotel shower, and great leisure facilities

reviews.text: Breakfast was unbelievable, and for once in a chain hotl worth the money. The bars are very cosmopolitan and the staff exceptinally friendly.
reviews.title: wonderful modern luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a five day stay at the Le Meridien. We used Starwood points (4 for 5 days) so keep in mind our review is based on total hotel bill of $30 euros for 5 days. Location is fabulous. Can't be beat. Free mini bar is much appreciated - although the beer offered is the cheapest available (.57 euros in the grocery store) but still a great benefit. Room layout for us worked well, even though as other posters have mentioned the location of the toilet is a bit awkward. The shower is a "wet room" and on several occasions I literally drenched the whole room thanks to the multiple shower heads. The service is very very good especially housekeeping who keep the rooms spotless. We loved the bed, even more like a double than a queen, it was very very comfortable. The only downside of this hotel is the prices for ancillary products. Renting a move $19 euros, car to airport $45 euros, breakfast buffet $29 euros. Overall we really enjoyed our stay, its a clean, fashionable modern hotel that delivers a great vacation in a beautiful city.
reviews.title: A little piece of modern in the midst of history

reviews.text: This was my first time in Vienna , had an excellent stay. There is a reason I usually stay at starwood properties in europe the service never fails me. Staff was helpful and polite and made generally good reccomendations for dining locations that were also good value. Prime Location. Lobby was very contemporery but had great atmosphere. it was an A+ stay i would go back here anytime. Thanks for the great stay
reviews.title: a year ago but still remember was great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Le Meridien Hotel for my honeymoon. Le Meridien has a great location to see all of the sites in Vienna, cannot be beaten being just a stones throw from the Hofburg and the Opera House. Our room was spacious and comfortable, the hotel even threw in a free upgrade because it was our honeymoon (it was also the middle of the week). Service at the hotel, especially concierge and room service were especially friendly.
reviews.title: Really Nice but Lacking Austrian Flare

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My concerns about the hotel are superficial at best and shouldn't turn anyone away from staying at the hotel, but let it stand as fair warning. The bathroom (in the executive rooms at least). the toilet is but two small steps and one frosted plexiglass wall away from the bed. Which made things unnecessarily awkward for my new husband and myself. Also the hotel's check-in time isn't until either 2pm or 4pm (can't remember which). Either way for the haggard American traveler who just flew-in overnight and wasn't able to sleep on the plane it's a little frustrating. The front desk kept saying that our room would be ready in 20 minutes which of course was subject to several delays.
reviews.title: very nice place in away from all the bustle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also this hotel is very modern. There are, what I considered, odd modern art exhibits in the lobby that seem a little out of touch with the historic Vienna located right outside the hotel's doors.
reviews.title: Excellent !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location
reviews.title: Loved the Merdien Wien

reviews.text: The hotel is conveniently located close to most tourist attractions, shopping, as well as restaurants. It is next door to the Vienna State Opera, a 5 minute walk to the imperial palace buildings of the Hapsburgs, including Sissi Museum, Royal Chapel, Spanish Riding School, Albertina Museum, and a 5-10 minute walk to the Museumsquartier, Musikverein, Karlskirche, Kohlmarkt & Graben shopping area.
reviews.title: Great, modern hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service
reviews.title: In love with Vienna

reviews.text: From check-in to check-out, the service that we experienced was flawless, except on one occasion. Our breakfast was not included, so we ate at the hotel's cafe which serves pastries. The cafe was staffed with only 1 waitstaff, and so we spent a lot of time waiting to be served. If you're in a hurry or don't like waiting in general, I would recommend eating at the many nearby Viennese cafes instead.
reviews.title: Loved it.Perfect location .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Aside from one flaw in service, overall service is superb. The hotel have a team of ambassadors (equivalent to the concierge) that are knowledgeable, professional and helpful. Prior to our arrival in Vienna, they speedily helped me get tickets to see the Vienna's Boys Choir (for a commission charge, of course). Furthermore, my wake up calls were always on-time and courteous.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay....wish it had been longer!
Swanky plus great location=expensive
reviews.text: First of all let me say, I loved this hotel. We stayed here for 2 nights on a recent European vacation. We loved the trendy feel, cool art, and modern furnishings. These things come with a price, as all good things typically do.

reviews.title: THE place to stay in vienna
reviews.text: Check-in was simple. Everyone on staff was extremely friendly, helpful, and multilingual. We had an "executive suite" which meant a room with a desk in it. It was small. It was definitely not a suite by any stretch of the imagination. But what makes this hotel so awesome is the decor, the high ceilings, the great furniture, and the INCREDIBLE bathroom. Everything was very modern and trendy. The shower was possibly the greatest shower I have ever stepped into. I wish I could have brought it home with me. It's so good that it includes a stool to sit on, I suspect because many people have difficulty getting out of this marvelous invention.

reviews.title: Smashing hotel
reviews.text: The plasma screen TV was nice and the beds were super comfortable with nice linens and a heavy down comforter. We were so worn out one afternoon that we simply sat in the bed and watched several movies.

reviews.title: Good stuff!
reviews.text: Austria is a very beautiful, modern city. We caught an opera and did some shopping and overall had a great experience. We would definitely stay in this hotel again, although it certainly comes at a price.

This hotel is almost as fabulous as Vienna itself, and perfectly located. We stayed in an excutive twin room, it was spacious and the beds were large and really comfortable. We even had a view of the Hofburg and Burggarten from the window! The decor, funky lighting and gadgets make this hotel truly 21st century, it was spotlessly clean, with nice little extras you would expect for 5*. Staff were very polite and friendly, and certainly helped us to feel more than 'just another hotel guest'. A few little things were missing on a couple of occassions (e.g. the bath robes) but things were swiftly rectified. The free minibar was adequate, and additional drinks can obviously be ordered by room service (pots of hot chocolate, yum), which was very reasonably priced and on the whole pretty efficient. I would certainly recommend ordering breakfast in your room (see the photo) - we ordered museli, coffee and fruit and they wheeled in a specially laid table for us, all for around 16 euros. We also had breakfast in Aida, the pink cafe on the corner of the block, they do some very good giant croissants :o)
reviews.title: Lovely City Great Hotel
Excellent
reviews.text: I have stayed here on numerous business trips, since this hotel opened

reviews.title: Awesome Awesome Hotel
reviews.text: in 2004. After a few teething problems after opening, (namely the bathroom flooding while showering), this hotel has raised the bar and is an excellent hotel.
The rooms are ultra modern, with flat screen TVs, surround sound and superb power showers.
reviews.title: Loved the Le Meridien, so convenient!
Great Location on Inner Ring
reviews.text: The gym is small but fully equiped and has a fulltime fitness instructor.

reviews.title: Great Location, Comfortable Hotel
reviews.text: The location is very central.

This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. Its part of the Art/Tech hotels of the Meridien chain and its one of the nicest Meridien hotels I have seen. Everything is spotless. The rooms are modern, with lovely decor. The bathrooms are full of amenities and kept very clean (which is not an easy job, once you see how they are set up). The lighting in the room is truly a work of art and everything from the coffee maker to the hair dryer have their own unique design elements. The bed is supremely comfortable down or down-like material and luxurious. The staff were beyond wonderful. They noted on their own that it was my birthday and sent up a beautiful letter and bottle of champagne to my room while I was gone - I returned to fruit and champagne, simply because the person checking me in had noticed it was my birthday and I was alone in Vienna on that day. How many times does that happen in a hotel? The breakfast is superb. The location is one of the best in all Vienna, with all sorts of public transport nearby. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. I just LOVED it !
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel, Fantastic location, Fantastic Staff

reviews.text: Having experienced many of Vienna's finest hotels, I had one of my most enjoyable stays recently at Le Meridien. My room (814) was full of interesting details, and clearly much thought went into design and decor that was both modern and comfortable. My executive king room was very spacious and the view to the interior space, while not scenic, ensured quiet. The bed was perhaps the most comfortable I've ever encountered, with superb linen, and my only regret was not having the luxury of a leisurely morning to take breakfast in bed. I appreciated the fully stocked minibar, provided gratis and restocked daily with juices and still and fizzy water. As remarked by other reviewers, the location of Le Meridien is excellent, with easy access on foot to most of Vienna's historic highlights and close to the subway and tram.
reviews.title: Vienna's Chic, Modern Choice

reviews.text: I found the hotel staff very pleasant to deal with from the moment I arrived. Check in was courteous and efficient. I worked with the young ladies at the concierge desk several times and found them very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Outstanding designer hotel in the heart of Vienna

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only real concern was with the bathroom. There was a lack of counter space, and the heated mirror made the room a little warm for my taste. The shower fixture was a bit odd, and I could not prevent it from flooding the room, despite the advice offered by other TripAdvisor members. This is a design flaw that I hope the hotel addresses. That having been said, the lighting was good and I loved the pink clawfoot tub. Also, the amenities, including the grapefruit hand lotion, were first rate.
reviews.title: Great location, very nice rooms, tres modern !
GREAT HOTEL
reviews.text: Finally, I would like to suggest that the hotel provide an alarm clock in the room and water in plastic bottles. There was no where in the hotel, including the cafe, where one could purchase water in anything but a glass bottle requiring an opener. This is really inconvenient for people on the go.

The best thing about this hotel is it location. It's within 5 minute walk from the U1: Karlsplatz subway station and that station is only two stops from where you catch the subw3ay connection if you take the CAT from the airport to the city centre. The hotel is right across the street from the Wiener Staatsper (Vienna Stata Opera House) and about 10 minute walk to the Domkirche St. Stephan (St. Staphan's Church). While walking to the Church, you will walk along the street Karntnerstrasse, which is a major shopping area. The hotel is also only about 5 minute walk from the Museum Quarter. All in all, it's within walking distance to a great number of tourist attractions.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location and nice staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I did not book it through Starwoodhotels[--] and I e-mailed them as well as called the Starwood 1-800 customer line to requested for an early check in and late check out. I also requested for a room with a bath tub. The early check in was ok, but oddly enough, they have no record of the late check out request (I actually requested it again with the front desk, otherwise they would have charge me an additional day of rent). And of course, they weren't able to give me a room with a bath tub, which is disappointing. I was told that they usually treat their Starwood members better, and if you are booking this hotel, I suggest you book through them.
reviews.title: Pleasant surprise
What a funky Hotel!
reviews.text: When you first walk into the room, I can't imagine anyone that wouldn't be WOWed (see the attached pictures). It has a very modern decor. You can't possibly beat the free mini bar and the free high speed internet (you need you laptop though). Free green apples are supplied everyday. I see a lot of people complainning about the three nozzel shower. The trick is to lay some towels on the floor. It's still a hassel but at least you won't have a flooded bathroom afterwards. The pillow is extremely comfortable (the best compared to all the other same class hotels I have stayed in). The bed is bit soft, so it may be a problem if you have a back problem. I love the plasma TV, although it was mounted straight at you whether you sit on the couch or the bed - you have to watch the TV from an angle. There are not too many English only channel (may be three - CNN world, BBC world, and I thinkg MTV). The hotel menu on the TV allows you to check messages, set up morning call, check bill, etc. which is almost a standard for this class of hotels.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The mini bar is great, always stocked fully with Coke (diet and classic), water, beer, and juice. The also have instand coffee. The electronic kettle has a very short wire, once you plug it in, you cannot moce the turntable. And the plug is so hidden in the wall that I almost burnt myself unplugging it one time. Strangely, the cleaning staff always forgot to empty the kettle. I also liek the fact that they have a mini safe. It's always a utility I look for in a hotel.
reviews.title: It was ok...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ons strike against them is that there are used clother from the previous guest in the drawer. I cannot possibly imagine how this would happen in a hotel of this class.
reviews.title: Really Disliked this Hotel

reviews.text: I have stayed many times at the Le Meredien and have always had a great stay. The overall hotel is very techno modern. The rooms are quite nice..Bedding very comfortable including pillows and complimentary mini - bar. The cafe at the hotel is very nice for getting a quick bite to eat. The location is near the central district and Opera house and Ringstrasse very short walking distance. Close to public transportation as well. Free wi fi makes it a pleasure to stay in your room as well. My only complaint is that their very tecno shower (which many enjoy) because it has multiple jets at different levels can leave the bathroom floor quite wet. I have gotten the knack of using the shower to minimize the overage but it takes some practice.
reviews.title: One of my favorite hotels in the world

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Botique Hotel , nice art works at the lobbey, great view from the room ,excellent location , helpful staff , clean and trendy rooms . Free WIFI , fresh apples , flat screen TV, bath tube , great value for money ( through hotwire ) couldn't ask for more !
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: Location is definitely a plus! National Library to your left (facing the street from main door) and Opera House to your right. Hotel is quite unique in artistry, color, and design. Impressive use of lighting in room. Our room was spacious with high ceiling and one large window. Plenty of spaces are available for your travel stuff/ clothes. Bathroom is equipped with his and hers sink. Room beverages are complimentary. Love the smell of new carpeting. FYI: 30 minute taxi ride to/fro from airport; 45 euros each way. Only comment: bed is firm.
reviews.title: Close to Opera House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This 5-Star property is among the coolest hotels I have enjoyed. The unconventional lobby is just the beginning. It is more similar to an art gallery than hotel. Elevators have only blue lights which beats harsh white lights. Lights in the ultra mod bathrooms can either be white or lime green! Comfy, hip furnishings throughout. Free use of 1st floor healthclub, pool, sauna. Excellent location in central Vienna.
reviews.title: Hip, Cool, Chic & Trendy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is not your typical old world Viennese hotel. It is basically a business hotel with some up market modern arty touches in the lobby - with young, slick staff and very crisp neat rooms. We enjoyed our week in a suite - but it would have made more sense if our kids had come. The location is perfection for tourists although the cost and the business features seem to position it more as a business hotel for small conventions and meetings rather than as an out and out fun place to absorb the local culture.
reviews.title: Not your typical Viennese hotel
Great Location and Fantastic hotel
reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location right across the street from the Opera House. You can walk to the center in 10 minutes. The hotel room itself is sharp, clean, very well detailed and modern. Absolutely love it.

Transporatation: From the airport, catch the CAT Train to Wien Mitte. This costs 8 euros one way or a little cheaper is buying a roundtrip ticket. If you have a family, buy the family pass. It's 25 euros for roundtrip good for travel within 30 days. A family with 2 adults and upto 4 kids can use it. Great deal! Once you get to Wien Mitte, go and buy a subway pass for the U4 line towards Hutteldorf. Get off at the 2nd stop which is Karlsplatz. Once you get off the train, go upstairs and make a left towards McDonalds. Exit at the Opernring exit. When facing the Opera House, the hotel is across the street on the left side, about 100 yards away.
reviews.title: Too Trendy?

reviews.text: Currency-- We had no euros when we arrived into Vienna. We paid all transportation costs by credit card. Once we got to the hotel, we found a bank and got the proper currency at a fair exchange rate.
reviews.title: Super Minimal and Modern

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As other reviewers have said this hotel is beautifully designed, very modern, very chic designer bathrooms etc but I just wonder if they have done all this and forgotten what running a hotel should be about! We arrived late evening to a shambolic reception, shown to an unclean room, separated by a long corridor from our children's room (when we had requested adjacent rooms) and then the whole thing dealt with as if it was our fault! Eventually we got sorted out with rooms, but affter quite a delay, and it was getting late. However the rooms are lovely and the location good and the food excellent. Maybe just a bit too trendy for their own good!
reviews.title: Superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After we had problems with the check in since they lost our reservation and we had to call our Travel agent in Cyprus and made him open his office on a Sunday early morning to fax them the reservation, we were upgraded but the room had as a view the back side of the hotel. What impressed us was the very artistic decoration with bright red furniture, modern lights, very nice lounge-bar. the room was very high-tech with a glass head board of the huge bed which lit at night and had the shape of a horse, plasma TV, fresh fruit in the room, very nice colours, smart minimal decor. The bathroom large, modern, but inconvenient and serves most the purpose of nice decor. the Spa is very nice , but they allow too many children and it´s very loud. Breakfast is average.
reviews.title: The contemporary design has WOW! factor, but watch out for mis-representations.

description: Le Méridien Vienna is an art hotel in Vienna that conveys modern European design and lifestyle but is yet typically Viennese.Discover more than meets the eye; transition from the outside world into the world of Le Méridien. Experience our Unlock ArtTM programme, keys that open more than just guest room doors. Elevate your senses during your stay in Vienna.Between two historical parks and encompassed by art and architecture, the design hotel Le Méridien Vienna marks the front edge of the historic Ringstrasse.
